title: Securities Exchange Act - 2017
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet has been granted to introduce a new Act in lieu of the Securities and Exchange Commission Act, No.36 of 1987 to suit the challenges presently faced by the Capital Market. As such, the proposed 'Securities Exchange Bill' has been formulated for Sri Lanka, taking into consideration the regulatory principles and standards adopted by the stock exchange regulatory institutions which function successfully in the developing countries.  

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and to present the same in Parliament thereafter for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.
